intro: Melampyrum esquirolii, commonly known as the yellow betony, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Melampyrum esquirolii typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
